Module com.project.appointmentscheduler.main
Package com.project.appointmentscheduler.controller

Class CustomerController

java.lang.Object
com.project.appointmentscheduler.controller.CustomerController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class CustomerController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controls interactions between Customer class objects and the Customers FXML window.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Displays all customers in the table and adds change listener to watch for selected customers in table. Assigns selected customer to the customer associated with the last row clicked.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      resourceBundle - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

    • getSelectedCustomer

      Returns the customer that is currently selected

      the customer that is currently selected

    • clearSelectedCustomer

      public static void clearSelectedCustomer()
      Deselects the currently selected customer

    • onNew

      public void onNew(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Redirects user to New Customer window.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action that triggered the button
      Throws:
      IOException - if an input or output exception occurs

    • onUpdate

      public void onUpdate(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Redirects user to Update Customer window if a customer is selected. An alert is displayed if no customer is selected.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action that triggered the button
      Throws:
      IOException - if an input or output exception occurs

    • onDelete

      public void onDelete(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws SQLException
      Deletes selected customer if there aren't any appointments assigned to the customer. Presents warnings if no customer is selected, the deletion doesn't change any rows in database, or the customer still has appointments.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action that triggered the button
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a SQL exception occurs

    • onBack

      public void onBack(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Redirects user to Main Menu.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action that triggered the button
      Throws:
      IOException - if an input or output exception occurs

    • signOut

      public void signOut(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Redirects user to Login window. Current user is unassigned.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action that triggered the button
      Throws:
      IOException - if an input or output exception occurs
